org.apache.paimon.catalog

Class AbstractCatalog

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.paimon.catalog.AbstractCatalog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Catalog
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileSystemCatalog, HiveCatalog

    public abstract class AbstractCatalog
extends Object
implements Catalog
    Common implementation of Catalog.

      • createDatabase

        public void createDatabase(String name,
                           boolean ignoreIfExists)
                    throws Catalog.DatabaseAlreadyExistException
        Description copied from interface: Catalog
        Create a database.
        Specified by:
        createDatabase in interface Catalog
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the database to be created
        ignoreIfExists - Flag to specify behavior when a database with the given name already exists: if set to false, throw a DatabaseAlreadyExistException, if set to true, do nothing.
        Throws:
        Catalog.DatabaseAlreadyExistException - if the given database already exists and ignoreIfExists is false

        Parameters:

        partitionSpec - the partition to be deleted

        Catalog.TableNotExistException - if the table does not exist

      • createDatabaseImpl

        protected abstract void createDatabaseImpl(String name)

      • dropDatabase

        public void dropDatabase(String name,
                         boolean ignoreIfNotExists,
                         boolean cascade)
                  throws Catalog.DatabaseNotExistException,
                         Catalog.DatabaseNotEmptyException
        Description copied from interface: Catalog
        Drop a database.
        Specified by:
        dropDatabase in interface Catalog
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the database to be dropped.
        ignoreIfNotExists - Flag to specify behavior when the database does not exist: if set to false, throw an exception, if set to true, do nothing.
        cascade - Flag to specify behavior when the database contains table or function: if set to true, delete all tables and functions in the database and then delete the database, if set to false, throw an exception.
        Throws:
        Catalog.DatabaseNotEmptyException - if the given database is not empty and isRestrict is true
        Catalog.DatabaseNotExistException

      • dropDatabaseImpl

        protected abstract void dropDatabaseImpl(String name)

      • listTables

        public List<String> listTables(String databaseName)
                        throws Catalog.DatabaseNotExistException
        Description copied from interface: Catalog
        Get names of all tables under this database. An empty list is returned if none exists.

        NOTE: System tables will not be listed.

        Specified by:
        listTables in interface Catalog
        Returns:
        a list of the names of all tables in this database
        Throws:
        Catalog.DatabaseNotExistException - if the database does not exist

      • listTablesImpl

        protected abstract List<String> listTablesImpl(String databaseName)

      • dropTable

        public void dropTable(Identifier identifier,
                      boolean ignoreIfNotExists)
               throws Catalog.TableNotExistException
        Description copied from interface: Catalog
        Drop a table.

        NOTE: System tables can not be dropped.

        Specified by:
        dropTable in interface Catalog
        Parameters:
        identifier - Path of the table to be dropped
        ignoreIfNotExists - Flag to specify behavior when the table does not exist: if set to false, throw an exception, if set to true, do nothing.
        Throws:
        Catalog.TableNotExistException - if the table does not exist

      • dropTableImpl

        protected abstract void dropTableImpl(Identifier identifier)

      • createTable

        public void createTable(Identifier identifier,
                        Schema schema,
                        boolean ignoreIfExists)
                 throws Catalog.TableAlreadyExistException,
                        Catalog.DatabaseNotExistException
        Description copied from interface: Catalog
        Create a new table.

        NOTE: System tables can not be created.

        Specified by:
        createTable in interface Catalog
        Parameters:
        identifier - path of the table to be created
        schema - the table definition
        ignoreIfExists - flag to specify behavior when a table already exists at the given path: if set to false, it throws a TableAlreadyExistException, if set to true, do nothing.
        Throws:
        Catalog.TableAlreadyExistException - if table already exists and ignoreIfExists is false
        Catalog.DatabaseNotExistException - if the database in identifier doesn't exist

      • createTableImpl

        protected abstract void createTableImpl(Identifier identifier,
                                        Schema schema)

      • renameTable

        public void renameTable(Identifier fromTable,
                        Identifier toTable,
                        boolean ignoreIfNotExists)
                 throws Catalog.TableNotExistException,
                        Catalog.TableAlreadyExistException
        Description copied from interface: Catalog
        Rename a table.

        NOTE: If you use object storage, such as S3 or OSS, please use this syntax carefully, because the renaming of object storage is not atomic, and only partial files may be moved in case of failure.

        NOTE: System tables can not be renamed.

        Specified by:
        renameTable in interface Catalog
        Parameters:
        fromTable - the name of the table which need to rename
        toTable - the new table
        ignoreIfNotExists - Flag to specify behavior when the table does not exist: if set to false, throw an exception, if set to true, do nothing.
        Throws:
        Catalog.TableNotExistException - if the fromTable does not exist
        Catalog.TableAlreadyExistException - if the toTable already exists

      • renameTableImpl

        protected abstract void renameTableImpl(Identifier fromTable,
                                        Identifier toTable)

      • alterTable

        public void alterTable(Identifier identifier,
                       List<SchemaChange> changes,
                       boolean ignoreIfNotExists)
                throws Catalog.TableNotExistException,
                       Catalog.ColumnAlreadyExistException,
                       Catalog.ColumnNotExistException
        Description copied from interface: Catalog
        Modify an existing table from SchemaChanges.

        NOTE: System tables can not be altered.

        Specified by:
        alterTable in interface Catalog
        Parameters:
        identifier - path of the table to be modified
        changes - the schema changes
        ignoreIfNotExists - flag to specify behavior when the table does not exist: if set to false, throw an exception, if set to true, do nothing.
        Throws:
        Catalog.TableNotExistException - if the table does not exist
        Catalog.ColumnAlreadyExistException
        Catalog.ColumnNotExistException

        Description copied from interface: Catalog

        System tables can be got by '$' splitter.

        Returns:
